Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed
on July 28, 2020. Due to the DHHS policy/contract noncompliance, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all additional ISEP requirements.
3) The facility is in compliance with all DHHS contract/policy requirements except:
RFCAN MISACWIS Restraint and Seclusion reporting complete and
Contract up to date
2.10
Vista Maria is entering restraint/seclusion data into
MISACWIS. MDHHS procedural changes as of 7/16/20
require the data be entered into MISACWIS within 24 hours
of each event. Vista Maria continues experiencing
technical difficulties. Restraint/seclusion entries are not
showing up on the restraint/seclusion summary report
pulled monthly by the DCWL analyst. Additionally currently
error messages occur when reports are routed for approval
and debriefing details will not save. MISACWIS HELP
DESK tickets are currently open to resolve these issues.
(repeat non-compliance 2019 - three Vista Maria CCI
licenses that use restraint/seclusion)
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
New MISACWIS screens were added related to notifications and debriefing on
restraints/seclusion incident reporting. New procedures for saving and sending
incident reports to the DCWL mailbox were reviewed.
PA 116 definition of “personal restraint” and what is not “personal restraint” was
discussed (ie, escorts).
4

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
The facility uses one CPI restraint technique referred to as the standing two-
person control hold. No other techniques are approved by DCWL or sanctioned
by the agency. Use of other techniques resulted in a resident restraint violation.
The DCWL procedure for pulling clearances and criminal records changed in
2019. 2020 CR clearances and Ichats were not present in employee files during
the on-site review.
The facility’s use of restraint and seclusion decreased by approximately 65%
from the numbers reported in 2019.
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care in two years.
There was one violation of Discipline involving corporal punishment in two years.
The facility submitted 11 acceptable corrective action plans resulting from special
investigations in the past two years. Rule violations included:
R 400.4109 Program statement (X 4) – Not following Vista Maria policy
R 400.4112 Staff qualifications (X 4) – Staff inability/inexperience to perform job duties
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff (X 2) – Inadequate staff supervision
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio (X2) – Out of ratio
R 400.4142 Health services (X 2) – Routine and emergency medical treatment
R 400.4158 Discipline (X 2) – Inappropriate discipline
R 400.4159 Resident restraint (X 4) – Improper restraint technique used
On 7/23/20, the facility submitted 1 NEW corrective action plan for earlier
violations of R 112, 158 and 159 for which the previously approved CAPs were
deemed insufficient. This NEW CAP was approved and fully implemented in
August 2020.
5

V. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended this license be
Renewed to Regular.
